## History of EEG

![](hans-berger.png)

Hans Berger, considered the father of EEG, was the first to record EEG in humans while working as a professor of psychiatry at the University of Jena in Germany.

# Terminology

## Frequency

Frequencies are quoted either in cycles per second (cps) or in Hertz (Hz)

| Band Name | Frequency Range |
|:--------- | :-------------- |
| alpha | 0 - <4 Hz |
| theta | 4 - <8 Hz |
| delta | 8 - 13 Hz | 
| beta | >13 Hz | 

## Fourier Theorem

- Important to "deconstruct" EEG waves to their component frequencies. 

- Joseph Fourier
- mathematical theorem: no matter how simple/complex, any waveform can be described by sum of sufficient number of simple sine waves
